description: Silent, apathetic yet mischievous, 14-year-old Rokujou Miharu is the bearer of the hijutsu, "Shinrabanshou", a powerful technique many ninja clans desire to possess to become the ruler of Nabari. Fellow classmate Kouichi and his English teacher Kumohira are both secretly Banten clan ninjas, pledging themselves to protect Miharu from his many attackers. Keeping apathetic, Miharu attempts to reject their invitation to join their ninja ‘club’ however, after numerous attacks; he finds no choice but to join their group as a means for his survival. Slowly, Miharu takes a step closer to becoming the ruler of Nabari.

node.description:
[Website](http://themonicarial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rialisms) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rialisms/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCaY5WvG6QScTq6dlRbCbp7Q)

An American voice actress, ADR director, and script writer affiliated with Funimation and Seraphim Digital/Sentai Filmworks.

Monica's father is from Pontevedra, Galicia, Spain, and when she was young, her family would often visit there. She would translate for her younger brother some of the European Spanish-dubbed cartoons which included anime like Doraemon and Dragon Ball Z, often imitating the various characters. Monica studied ballet, tap, and jazz, but transitioned to musical theater when was 12. She studied acting through high school as well as college at the University of Houston. She's cited voice actor inspirations from The Simpsons, Family Guy, and Beavis and Butt-head. She was working on a theater show with Jason Douglas, who suggested she audition for ADV Films. Her first voice-over role was a walla in the 1999 dub of Martian Successor Nadesico.

(Source: Wikipedia, edited)

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Blog](https://corvusmr.exblog.jp/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/5265224) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/memeyuhkinto)

A Japanese manga artist and illustrator best known for their series Nabari no Ou, published by Square Enix.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉島邦久)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉島邦久)

[Website](http://www.michiru-oshima.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OshimaMichiru) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6zqZlqpjrq3op255dF32Fr?autoplay=true)

She is a composer who has worked on several video game, movie, and television titles. Her works include composition for the video games Ico for PlayStation 2, Arc the Lad III, and an orchestral arrangement of a Zelda medley for the Wii and Gamecube game The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess. In addition to video game music, she has composed music for the Godzilla movies and scores for numerous anime television series, including Fullmetal Alchemist (and the motion picure Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa), Queen Emeraldas and Bounen no Xamdou. She was also the composer for a Japanese stage musical adaptation of the classic Hollywood film Roman Holiday.

Ooshima graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music, Department of Music Composition. Afterwards she began her activities as a composer and arranger while in college, and has been involved in making music for movies, commercials, TV programs, animated features, and ambient music. While in college, she released a symphony entitled "Orasho". Through her masterful manipulation of both orchestras and synthesizers, she has attracted attention from various sectors for creating grandiose, dramatic sounds and beautiful melodies. Her awards include the Mainichi Film Contest Award for Best Music, and the 21st, 24th, 26th, 27th, 29th and 30th Japanese Academy Award for Music, and Jackson Hole Film Festival 2007(USA) Best Composer Award.

__Agency:__ Smile Company (2007-2020)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ELISA_0414) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/elisa_0414/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/elisa.smile.official)__

ＥＬＩＳＡ (エリサ) is a Japanese pop singer and model of elite model management Japan. She debuted with the single, 「 euphoric field feat. ELISA 」.  She knew the pleasure of singing by joined a choir at the age of a seventh grader then played piano from 3 years old. At the age of a ninth grader, she participated in the national choir convention. At the age of a tenth grader, she joined and played opera. Her favorite opera is “The Marriage of Figaro” of Mozart.  She applied for model audition “elite Model Look 2007” to try her possibility at the age of an eleventh grader. The 10 finalists will be elected to the National Convention.  The opera which she sang at the time of audition serves as a major debut in October of the year by an opportunity.  Her debut single is 「euphoric field feat.ELISA 」 (TV Anime “ef-a tale of memories” opening theme) records the 22nd place on ORICON chart at first appearance and a longtime seller becomes it afterwards and records an exceptional world-beater more than 30,000 pieces as a rookie.  She released 2nd single 「HIKARI 」 (TV Anime “Nabari no Ou” ending theme) in May, 2008 and strengthened presence as the singer in a contrastive ballad song with the debut at a stretch. Furthermore, She appeared in “2008 Animelo Summer Live -Challenge-” in August, 2008 and overwhelm about 18,000 people.
In September 2020, Elisa allegedly suffered sexual harassment from her manager. She has terminated her contract with Smile Company.
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/245226/Yuuichi-Tanaka)._

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shichiro_kobayashi/)

A former art director and a guest professor at Kobe Design University.

Kobayashi graduated from Musashino Art University and first became an elementary school art teacher. It was only later that he joined the animation industry in 1964. He started quickly making a name for himself as a background artist and consequently established his own background art studio Kobayashi Production, in 1968. During this time thick poster paint was dominating the backgrounds in anime, but Kobayashi started a new style with much thinner painting and colored pencil strokes.

He has worked as an art director on over 100 titles and is one of the most distinguished art directors in the medium. Notable works include [Gamba no Bouken](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/), [Ie Naki Ko](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/), [Takarajima](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/), [Tenshi no Tamago](https://anilist.co/anime/885/), [Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/) and [Nodame Cantabile](https://anilist.co/anime/1698/).

Kobayashi retired from the industry in 2010, which was followed by his studio's closedown a year later.

In a 2015 [interview](https://youtu.be/V1tiKOsCz2M), Kobayashi talked about his life and passion in painting touring his atelier and showcasing his work.
The brother of voice actress, [Brina Palencia](https://anilist.co/staff/95659/Brina-Palencia).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷口守泰)
